definition: Shennong or Farmer God (c. 2000 BC), first of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] and creator of agriculture in China/followers or clan of Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2]
see 月氏[Yue4 zhi1] and 閼氏|阏氏[yan1 zhi1]

sentences.english: According to a Chinese ancient legend , Shen Nong discovered tea.
sentences.chinese: 根據一箇中國古代的傳說，神農氏發現了茶葉。

sentences.english: Don't you forget that Shennong, the Yan Emperor, was the chief of the ancient Qiang tribesmen.
sentences.chinese: 你忘了，這炎帝神農氏是古時候羌族的首領。

definition: Yao or Tang Yao (c. 2200 BC), one of Five Legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4], second son of Di Ku 帝嚳|帝喾[Di4 Ku4]
Shang Tang (1646-? BC), legendary founder of the Shang Dynasty
Shennong or Farmer God (c. 2000 BC), first of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] and creator of agriculture
Bamboo Annals, early chronicle of Chinese ancient history, written c. 300 BC
Zou Yan (305-240 BC), founder of the School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
Nêdong county, Tibetan: Sne gdong rdzong, in Lhokha prefecture 山南地區|山南地区[Shan1 nan2 di4 qu1], Tibet
Zhuan Xu, one of the Five Legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4], grandson of the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4], trad. reigned 2513-2435 BC
Song of the Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479), with capital at Nanjing
